text: Who identifies himself as the author of 2 John?
verseText: The elder to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in truth...

text: Who is the recipient of 2 John?
options: 'The elect lady and her children' (likely a church and its members)
verseText: The elder to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in truth...

text: What two themes, prominent in 1 John, are central to 2 John?
verseText: ...whom I love in truth... Grace, mercy, and peace will be with us, from God the Father and from Jesus Christ the Father's Son, in truth and love. I rejoiced greatly to find some of your children walking in truth... And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments...

text: John rejoices because he found some of the 'elect lady's' children walking in what?
verseText: I rejoiced greatly to find some of your children walking in truth, just as we were commanded by the Father.

text: What commandment does John remind the recipients of in 2 John?
verseText: And now I ask you, dear lady—not as though I were writing you a new commandment, but the one we have had from the beginning—that we love one another.

text: John warns about the presence of many 'deceivers' who deny what?
options: That Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
verseText: For many deceivers have gone out into the world, those who do not confess the coming of Jesus Christ in the flesh. Such a one is the deceiver and the antichrist.

text: What specific instruction does John give regarding how to treat these deceivers?
options: Invite them into your house for discussion
Do not receive them into your house or give them any greeting
verseText: If anyone comes to you and does not bring this teaching, do not receive him into your house or give him any greeting,

text: Why does John warn against even greeting such deceivers?
options: Whoever greets them takes part in their wicked works
verseText: for whoever greets him takes part in his wicked works.

text: How does John express his desire to communicate further with the recipients?
options: He hopes to visit and speak face to face
verseText: Though I have much to write to you, I would rather not use paper and ink. Instead I hope to come to you and talk face to face, so that our joy may be complete.

text: 2 John is one of the shortest books in the New Testament, focusing on the importance of holding to the truth and avoiding fellowship with whom?
options: Those who deny the core truths about Christ
verseText: (The letter warns against supporting or encouraging those who teach heresy, particularly regarding the incarnation of Christ).
